overview.description: Configure system-wide settings for security, notifications, integrations, and operational parameters
overview.whatItDoes: Central control panel for all system configuration including firm branding, security policies, notification rules, and third-party integrations
overview.whyItMatters: Settings affect every user and operation. Misconfiguration can cause security breaches, workflow disruptions, or compliance violations.
keyBenefits: Audit trail for all setting changes
overview.criticalNote: ⚠️ Settings changes take effect immediately for all users. Review carefully before saving.

configure-general.title: Configure General Settings
configure-general.description: Set up basic firm information, timezone, and display preferences
steps: Enter firm name and display settings
Upload logo for branding (appears in documents and portal)
Set timezone for all date/time displays
Set default currency for financial fields
tips: Logo should be high resolution for document quality
Timezone affects deadline calculations - set correctly
Fiscal year affects financial reporting periods

configure-security.title: Configure Security Settings
configure-security.description: Set authentication policies, session management, and access controls
tips: Balance security with usability
Shorter timeouts are more secure but may frustrate users
2FA significantly improves security for all users
warnings: IP whitelist can lock out users working remotely - add VPN IPs
Enabling 2FA requires all users to set up authenticator apps
Very short session timeouts may cause work loss
securityBestPractices: Session timeout: 30-60 minutes for standard use
Require 2FA for Admin and Partner roles at minimum
Set password minimum length to 12+ characters
Enable account lockout after 5 failed attempts

configure-notifications.title: Configure Notification Settings
configure-notifications.description: Set up email, SMS, and in-app notification preferences
steps: Configure email sender address and display name
Set up SMS provider credentials (if using)
Define notification triggers for each event type
Set default reminder timings for deadlines
Configure escalation rules for overdue items
Set digest vs. real-time preference defaults
tips: Test email delivery before going live
Use digest mode to reduce email volume
Escalation rules should match management expectations
warnings: Incorrect email configuration will prevent all notifications
SMS has per-message costs - review before enabling

configure-integrations.title: Configure Integrations
configure-integrations.description: Set up connections to external services like calendars, storage, and APIs
steps: Enter API keys or authorize via OAuth
availableIntegrations: Google Calendar - Sync hearings and deadlines
Microsoft Outlook - Calendar and email integration
Cloud Storage - Document backup to external storage
GSTIN API - Automatic client data fetch
tips: Test integrations in sandbox before production
Keep API keys secure and rotate periodically
Monitor sync logs for errors

configure-workflows.title: Configure Workflow Settings
configure-workflows.description: Set up case stages, approval workflows, and automation rules
steps: Configure case stage definitions and transitions
Set up SLA rules for each stage
Set up notification rules for workflow events
tips: Map workflows to actual business processes
Test stage transitions with sample cases
Keep workflows simple - complexity reduces adoption

configure-defaults.title: Configure Default Values
configure-defaults.description: Set system-wide defaults for new records
steps: Set default case priority, status, and assignment rules
Configure default document categories and retention
Set default task templates for common operations
Configure default notification preferences for new users
tips: Defaults reduce data entry effort
Review defaults periodically as processes evolve
Users can override defaults when needed

backup-restore.title: Backup and Restore
backup-restore.description: Manage system backups and data recovery
steps: Download backup files for offline storage
For restore: Contact support with backup file
tips: Download periodic backups for disaster recovery
Verify backup integrity regularly
Document restore procedures for emergency access
warnings: Full restore replaces all current data - use with extreme caution

critical.risk: Can permanently lock out all users if misconfigured
critical.mitigation: Always include current IP and emergency backup IP before saving

critical.risk: Reduces account security for all users
critical.mitigation: Only disable temporarily for troubleshooting, re-enable immediately

important.risk: Very long timeouts (>4 hours) increase session hijack risk
important.mitigation: Use 30-60 minute timeouts for balance of security and usability

important.risk: Short retention may violate compliance requirements
important.mitigation: Check regulatory requirements before reducing retention periods

commonMistakes.mistake: Enabling IP whitelist without including own IP
commonMistakes.prevention: Always test whitelist before saving, keep emergency access method

commonMistakes.mistake: Changing timezone after data entry has begun
commonMistakes.impact: All timestamps appear incorrect, deadline confusion
commonMistakes.prevention: Set timezone during initial setup, never change in production

commonMistakes.impact: Users lose work frequently, frustration and workarounds
commonMistakes.prevention: Balance security with usability, 30-60 minutes is typically optimal
Always keep deadline and SLA breach notifications enabled

admin.responsibilities: Configure, maintain, and audit all system settings
admin.tips: Document all changes, test in staging first, maintain change log

partner.access: View settings, limited edit for firm branding
partner.tips: Review settings monthly, understand security implications

implementor.responsibilities: Initial setup, configuration, and knowledge transfer
implementor.tips: Document all configurations, create admin training materials

faqs.question: How do I recover from an IP whitelist lockout?
faqs.answer: Contact system support with admin credentials. They can disable whitelist from backend. Always keep emergency contact info accessible outside the system.

faqs.question: Can I undo a settings change?
faqs.answer: Settings have audit logs showing previous values. Manual restoration is required - contact admin to revert.

faqs.question: Do settings changes affect existing data?
faqs.answer: Most settings affect new operations only. Some (like timezone) affect display of existing data. Review change impact before saving.
